summary.para: Deprecated. Gets a connection point for browser events.

param.name: ppccp
param.para: Receives the address of pointer to connection point.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: dispidMember
param.para: Specifies a dispatch ID that identifies the member being invoked.

param.name: lcid
param.para: Specifies a locale ID providing a locale context in which to interpret arguments. Applications that do not support multiple national languages can ignore this parameter.

param.name: wFlags
param.para: Specifies flags describing the context of the call.

param.name: pdispparams
param.para: Specifies a pointer to a structure containing an array of arguments, an array of argument DISPIDs for named arguments, and counts for the number of elements in the arrays.

param.name: pVarResult
param.para: Receives a pointer to the location where the result is to be stored, or NULL if the calling application expects no result. This argument is ignored if DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUT or DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUTREF is specified.

param.name: pexcepinfo
param.para: Receives a pointer to a structure that contains exception information. This structure should be filled in if DISP_E_EXCEPTION is returned. Can be NULL.

param.name: puArgErr
param.para: Receives the index within the rgvarg member of the structure of the first argument that has an error.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the MSG structure describing the keystroke to be processed.

param.name: grfModifiers
param.para: Specifies the flags describing the state of the Control, Alt, and Shift keys. The value of the flag can be any valid KEYMODIFIERS enumeration values.

summary.para: Deprecated. Exposes methods that allow the retrieval of properties, translation of keyboard accelerators, and determination of a connection point for certain events.
